TopicTitle: Learning the hard way with mods

Articles.Content:
Whatever rank a rookie is, I'm one below that. I can't fly fer shiite. Started out too fast in this game by loading a lot of mods before I knew what to do with them. Apparently one or more of these mods has had adverse affects in the game. For example I had done some of the tutorials and after loading about 20 mods at once, now all of a sudden I can't play those training sessions anymore. The take me back to a  point a couple of seconds before the ship was about to crash, it did crash and the session was over  and if I tried to do it again, I would still go back to where the ship would crash again. Couldn't do any one of them all the way through anymore. I then got rid of all my mods and now I can play the training session from start to finish again.  Don't know which of those mods affected this cause I had put in so many at once (using ckan). I'll now have to try putting then back in one at a time to see which one of was causing the issue I was having.

Edited January 6, 2018 by MikeO89
adding information

you haven't submitted any logs but if you aren't running the ksp_x64.exe version than you will crash like this.

 

hope this helps

Jammer

I wouldn't try the tutorials with mods installed. I recommend learning how to play the game (ie getting to orbit, landing on the mun/minmus, flying a plane etc) in stock first before trying to mod it, because mods make the game much more complex.

I was always running the x64. exe. Don't know how to access logs. The game was not crashing, just not letting me play the training sessions anymore after installing a bunch of mods.

Edited January 6, 2018 by MikeO89
Man oh man I suck rotten eggs at this game. Still on training sessions. Going to the Mun and landing there is absolutely kicking my butt.
This thread provides information on how to find logs and stuff.
